p: Forecasting seasonal influenza after 26 weeks was defined as forecasting influenza pattern after six months (26 weeks) with data available only at the current point ( Fig 3). Four seasons for 2015–2019 were selected to validate the prediction models for seasonal influenza patterns. This is done because the training set accounted for 50% of eight seasons in the whole dataset for 2010–2018. For example, the prediction model for the seasonal influenza pattern during 2015–2016 used the influenza surveillance data from the 40 th week in 2010 to the 40 th week in 2015 as the training set ( Fig 4).
